caption: You can get an unobstructed view of the Eiffel Tower here. You can stand under the bridge, or on opposite sides of the streets, with no worries about traffic. This bridge is over the Seine River, where you get dinner cruise boat. In the late evenings, you can easily get a taxi from this location because they line the street.  This bridge is also featured in the Inception movie, with Leonardo Dicaprio.

One of the Best Eiffel Tower Photo Spots Pont de Bir-Hakeim is one of the most iconic spots to capture stunning photos of the Eiffel Tower in Paris. The steel bridge‚Äôs unique structure, combined with the elevated metro line running overhead, creates a romantic and modern atmosphere. From the bridge, you can enjoy a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower in the background, making it ideal for photography both during the day and at night, especially when the tower is illuminated.  What makes Pont de Bir-Hakeim even more popular is its spacious area, perfect for fashion photography or couple shots. Not only does the bridge offer a breathtaking view, but it also provides a true Parisian vibe, making it a must-visit location for any traveler.
Very nice photo taking spots of the Eiffel Tower. Can walk to the champs de mars from here. Go early to avoid the crowds

Puente de Bir-Hakeim: Breathtaking views of Seine & Eiffel Tower! Stunning photography spot, especially at sunset. Remember: prioritize biker safety, yield to cyclists & pedestrians. For the love of God please be cautious: don't cross streets when cars approach. Respect traffic rules.

The Pont de Bir-Hakeim is a stunning double-decked bridge in Paris, spanning the Seine River and offering breathtaking views of the Eiffel Tower. Built between 1903 and 1905, it features elegant arches and ornate ironwork, exemplifying early 20th-century engineering and design. The bridge is both a functional piece of infrastructure and a popular spot for photographers and filmmakers, celebrated for its scenic beauty and iconic Parisian backdrop.

Iconic bridge with amazing views off the River Seine and Eiffel tower. Can get busy with photographers, tourists and locals taking in the views and experiencing all of Paris from a bridge. Nice walk over it.

Bir Hakim Bridge, a stunning steel arch bridge spanning the Seine River, connects the 15th and 16th arrondissements of Paris. Opened in 1906, this bridge is not only an important traffic route but also a remarkable piece of engineering and design.  The bridge features two levels: the upper level is used for vehicles, while the lower level accommodates pedestrians and cyclists, making it a popular spot for leisurely walks. The views from the bridge are breathtaking, offering panoramic sights of the Eiffel Tower, the Seine River, and the picturesque neighborhoods on either side.  Bir Hakim Bridge is particularly enchanting at sunset when the golden light casts a warm glow over the Seine. It‚Äôs also a favored location for photography, with its intricate ironwork and scenic backdrop providing the perfect frame for capturing unforgettable moments.  Surrounded by charming caf√©s and parks, Bir Hakim Bridge is a delightful place to relax and enjoy the beauty of Paris. Whether you‚Äôre crossing the bridge or simply soaking in the views, it‚Äôs an essential stop for anyone exploring the City of Light.

A beautiful and unique bridge in Paris, its incredible view of the Eiffel Tower, making it a perfect spot for photography. The lower level of the bridge has a walkway ideal for a peaceful stroll or bike ride, offering stunning views of the Seine River. The atmosphere around the bridge is calm and romantic, especially in the evening. It‚Äôs a must-visit spot for anyone exploring Paris!

This is one of the best bridges in Paris. It is a double decker bridge with road on lower level and metro on upper level. The bridge offers excellent view of Seine river. It is also great place to get view of Eiffel Tower. A must visit bridge to see Eiffel tower from the distance
This iconic double decker bridge spanning over the river Seine offers a spectacular view of the Eiffel tower. When in Paris, try to visit there.

This place is an iconic photoshoot for many couples. Either underneath the steel overpass for the metro or midway at the statue with the Eiffel Tower in the background it's a perfect place for a photo opportunity. I love coming to this place. It's fun watching all the limousines stop with the photographers and the brides or engaged couples doing a photo shoot.
Iconic bridge which has been shown on the all time great movie- Inception. Also an amazing angle to click pictures with the Eiffel Tower. Mostly not crowded.

We loved walking along the Bir Hakeim Bridge. One of the best places to take pictures of the Eiffel Tower (Tour Eiffel) because it's a very beautiful point of view of it!! Also, it is a very symmetrical bridge with nice columns. Good lines for pictures. Go in the early morning

We loved walking along the Bir Hakeim Bridge. One of the best places to take pictures of the Eiffel Tower (Tour Eiffel) because it's a very beautiful point of view of it!! Also, it is a very symmetrical bridge with nice columns. Good lines for pictures. Go in the early morning
One of many beautiful view points of the Eiffel tower in Paris is on the Pont de Bir Hakeim bridge.

This bridge should be renamed as 'Inception Bridge' as the hollywood movie made it very popular worldwide. Best bridge for photography with a Eiffel Tower view. Since the bridge is covered from top, it helps during monsoons for people to walk under it. Nice glass lamps light up during night. Overall a must visit bridge in Paris and ideal for early morning photoshoots.
Yes, this is the bridge from a scene in the movie Inception. It's also a great find because you get some great unobstructed views of the Eiffel Tower.
üóº Did you know? The second best view of the Eiffel Tower is from this quirky bridge. Perfect for Instagram! üì∏ ‚Ä¶

started my photographic weekend at this bridge. It can get very busy as there is a roadway on each side, a transit train up above, and a walkway directly under the bridge on the same level as the roadway. The iron architecture is very interesting and includes old rivets and archways which can be use din your photos. The bridge is across the Seine River and you can see multiple statues as well as the Eiffel Tower from it. Probably the best time to photograph is in the morning to avoid walking and car traffic.

This bridge seems to be a favourite spot for photographer with both Eiffel tower and Seine river as background as well as the remarkable pillars under the metro's rails. This lane under the metro's rail actually dedicated for cyclers, there are signs on it, but the lane is always busy with model, model, model. During my several visits here, I always bumped into professional photographers who were busy directing their models for posing. There are stairs to ƒ∞le des Cygnes, a small island that divides Seine river into two until Pont de Grenelle where the replica of Liberty Statue is situated.
Great place to get "that" shot from the Inception movie from the footpath below. There is a train that runs above it also.

Pont de Bir-Hakeim is a stunning bridge in Paris that offers incredible views of the Eiffel Tower and the Seine River. Whether you‚Äôre walking, biking, or just enjoying the scenery, it‚Äôs a spot that perfectly captures the charm of Paris.  But here‚Äôs a fun fact: this bridge was featured in the movie *Inception*! Remember that mind-bending scene where Leonardo DiCaprio and Ellen Page shatter the mirrors? Yep, that was filmed right here! It‚Äôs amazing to stand where movie magic happened and soak in the iconic Parisian atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit, especially if you‚Äôre a film buff or just love beautiful cityscapes. Add it to your must-see list in Paris!
Was fortunate enough to visit during the Olympics. With the ongoing road closures and station closures, it meant that Pont de Bir Hakeim was relatively quiet.
Ofcourse it‚Äôs a must see. It‚Äôs walkable from Eifel tower. It has good photo spots. You can oversee river Seine.
One of the most beautiful view to the Eiffel Tower is here. No need to buy a ticket.
This is the bridge from inception. Definitely a great photo op with scenic views of the eiffel tower. Also close to the mini statue of liberty.
A picturesque bridge with stunning views of the Eiffel Tower.
Got up early and took the metro to get some pics of the "Inception Bridge" for my friends and family back home. Also was able to get some nice shots of the Eiffel Tower.
Great place to take pictures with the Eiffel Tower in the background.
The region and popular bridge linking the Eiffel tower area with the Trocadero is lively with an island that is the berth of river cruise boats.
A beautiful and must-see place for tourists; this bridge was also featured in the movie Inception.

Best spot for Eiffel Tower pics üì∏.  I've been to Paris quite a few times, but my favorite spot for photos of the Eiffel Tower is right here at Pont de Bir Hakeim. It's a short beautiful walk from the tower along the Seine and it has a balcony, multiple lanterns, and the columns holding up the bridge frame the tower nicely.  This spot can get pretty crowded midday, so I suggest going in the morning or afternoon.
Great bridge with Iconic Eiffel Tower
This is one of my favourite places in Paris. Everytime I visit this city I make sure to spend some time here with my camera.
One of the best place to get your Eiffel Tower photoshoot apart from the Trocadero Square, which is full with tourists. This bridge has lesser people.

A great stop as you walk along the shores of the Seine.  This is an iconic view of Paris and a great place for a few photos of the Pont itself or with the Eiffel Tower in the background.  Glad we stopped here in our walks around Paris!
As a fan of Inception film ofc I wanted to visit this place. Gorgeous bridge, great view of Eiffel Tower.
